subject: Re: [junit] Re: mocking 3rd party classes?
msgSnippet: ... Then does it have a package-private constructor? Can you instantiate the class at all? Is the Message class itself tied to the external system? Can you
messageBody:
On 8/3/05, smatalonga <smatalonga@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I've been going over this thread but could not find the answer for my
> problem.
>
> I am working wiht a 3rd party api. Where I have to extend one of their
> clases and Inteact via a receiveAsyncMessage(Message) method.
>
> The Message class ha no default or public constructor.

Then does it have a package-private constructor? Can you instantiate
the class at all? Is the Message class itself tied to the external
system? Can you write some test code in the same package to
instantiate and populate it?
